intro: Metalasia seriphioides, commonly known as the silverleaf metalasia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun conditions. Its leaves are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive silvery appearance. Metalasia seriphioides is often used in native gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
